title: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)
desc: HTTPS is a secure protocol used to access web pages over the Internet, such as HTML documents. It is based on HTTP, which is the primary protocol to send data between a web browser and a website. HTTPS uses encryption to increase the security of each request. That is why you can often see that name in a URL alongside the famous little padlock. It is primordial to transmit sensitive data.
